title: Historical Dates
description: Can you recall when these major historical events took place?

questions.question: In what year did the Declaration of Independence get signed?
questions.explanation: The Declaration of Independence was signed on July 4, 1776, declaring the thirteen American colonies free from British rule.

questions.question: When did World War I begin?
questions.explanation: World War I began in 1914 after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, triggering a chain of alliances across Europe.

questions.question: In what year did the Titanic sink?
questions.explanation: The RMS Titanic sank on April 15, 1912, after hitting an iceberg during its maiden voyage from Southampton to New York City.

questions.question: When did humans first walk on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin walked on the Moon on July 20, 1969, during the Apollo 11 mission.

questions.question: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the beginning of German reunification and the end of the Cold War era in Europe.

questions.question: When was the Magna Carta signed?
questions.explanation: The Magna Carta was sealed by King John of England in 1215. It established key principles of law and individual rights.

questions.question: In what year did the French Revolution begin?
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille on July 14, a pivotal moment in European history.

questions.question: When did the Great Fire of London occur?
questions.explanation: The Great Fire of London swept through the city in September 1666, destroying much of the medieval City of London.

questions.question: In what year was the United Nations established?
questions.explanation: The United Nations was established on October 24, 1945, after World War II, with the goal of preventing future global conflicts.

questions.question: When did the Russian Revolution take place?
questions.explanation: The Russian Revolution of 1917 led to the fall of the Romanov dynasty and the rise of the Soviet Union under Bolshevik leadership.

questions.question: In what year was the Treaty of Westphalia signed, ending the Thirty Years' War?
questions.explanation: The Treaty of Westphalia was signed in 1648, ending the devastating Thirty Years' War and establishing the modern concept of state sovereignty.

questions.question: When was the Gutenberg printing press invented?
questions.explanation: Johannes Gutenberg invented his movable-type printing press around 1440, revolutionizing the spread of information across Europe.

questions.question: In what year did the Battle of Hastings take place?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Hastings occurred on October 14, 1066, when William the Conqueror defeated King Harold II to become King of England.

questions.question: When did the Ottoman Empire officially dissolve?
questions.explanation: The Ottoman Empire officially dissolved on November 1, 1922, when the Turkish Grand National Assembly abolished the sultanate.

questions.question: In what year was the Edict of Nantes issued, granting religious tolerance in France?
questions.explanation: The Edict of Nantes was signed by King Henry IV in 1598, granting French Protestants (Huguenots) substantial rights and freedoms.
